info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 12 at 8:28PM MDT until June 12 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Haakon County in west central South Dakota... * Until 915 PM MDT. * At 828 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Nowlin, or 18 miles east of Philip, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Midland around 845 PM MDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
